item.title: Porton Down: Can this laboratory help stop the next pandemic?
item.description: James Gallagher meets the scientists who work at one of the most secretive research bases in the UK.

item.title: Woman abused by paper which claims vaccine killed her son
item.description: Promoting a Covid conspiracy theory, the Irish Light's editor accuses the mum of "massive fraud".

item.title: Mother awake for 60 hours as son's care breaks down
item.description: NHS system for seriously ill people requiring home care is struggling to provide sufficient support.

item.title: Fines hiked for firms employing illegal migrants
item.description: Companies who repeatedly employ illegal migrants face fines up to £60,000 per breach under new rules.

item.title: Pakistan passenger train derails killing 30
item.description: Several coaches of the Hazara Express overturned near the Sahara station in the south of the country.

item.title: Mother and daughter first to go to space together
item.description: Anastatia Mayers and Keisha Schahaff won a place on Virgin Galactic's first commercial flight in a prize draw.

item.title: Barbie film hits $1bn mark at global box office
item.description: The pink-hued film has drawn in $1.03bn around the world, according to distributor Warner Bros.

item.title: Baby monitors and smart speakers enabling abuse, say MPs
item.description: MPs demand government action on the growing problem of 'tech-enabled' domestic violence.

item.title: Donald Trump says he will ask the Judge to step aside
item.description: Former US President Trump says that his lawyers will ask for a recusal of the judge on his election fraud case.

item.title: Netball World Cup final 2023: England 45-61 Australia - Roses miss out on historic title
item.description: England's wait for a first Netball World Cup title continues after Australia defeat the Roses to win the event for a 12th time.

item.title: Arsenal beat Man City in Community Shield
item.description: Arsenal give their hopes of beating Manchester City to the Premier League title a psychological boost by winning the Community Shield on penalties.

item.title: Zuckerberg 'not holding breath' over Musk cage fight
item.description: The two tech billionaires have also been going head to head over their rival platforms, X and Threads.

item.title: Florida: Man rescued from partially sunken boat after 35 hours at sea
item.description: The 25-year-old was reported missing after failing to return from a fishing trip in St Augustine, Florida.

item.title: The Papers: 'Plan B on Rwanda' as 'MPs defy second jobs anger'
item.description: Monday's front pages focus on immigration, and government plans for asylum seekers.

item.title: Belarus isolates political prisoners to break their spirit
item.description: Families of Belarusian political prisoners say loved ones are being denied any outside contact.

item.title: Families in Turkey's quake cities battle dust and rubble six months on
item.description: Six months on from the deadly earthquakes, thousands are still living in tents and makeshift camps.

item.title: The Russians hunting for cheap flats in occupied Mariupol
item.description: Largely destroyed by Russian forces, Mariupol is now portrayed by Moscow as a desirable city.

item.title: Imran Khan: Is his political future over now he is in jail?
item.description: His supporters appear scared with their leader behind bars. Has Pakistan's military eliminated yet another PM?

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: Why exit of holders USA was a predictable 'catastrophe'
item.description: The USA hoped to become the first team to win three successive Women's World Cup titles but made history of a very different kind.

item.title: Inflation: Should we trust the Bank of England's forecasts?
item.description: The Bank of England says inflation could fall to around 5% by Christmas - how reliable is that?

item.title: Elephant corridors: The busy trunk routes where locals take care to cross
item.description: The difficulties facing people living next to Botswana's growing African elephant population.

item.title: Niger coup: Ecowas deadline sparks anxiety in northern Nigeria
item.description: Niger's junta has hours to restore the ousted president or face the possibility of military action.

item.title: MrBeast: How the world's biggest YouTuber made his millions
item.description: Jimmy Donaldson is the biggest YouTuber in the world with 172 million subscribers - what makes him so popular?

item.title: Ahead of Ohio abortion vote, Republicans try to change the rules
item.description: Ohio looked ready to pass an abortion rights amendment. Then Republicans planned another vote.

item.title: Russia conscription laws change, leaving some fearful of Ukraine war call-up
item.description: As Russia increases the age limit for conscription, we speak to men afraid of being called up to Ukraine.

item.title: House prices are falling, so why can't I afford a home?
item.description: Figures this week showed house prices falling, but mortgage costs remain high.

item.title: Five arrested as protest halts elite UCI cycling race
item.description: The UCI world championship men's road race from Edinburgh to Glasgow is stopped for 50 minutes near the Carron Valley Reservoir.

item.title: Eddie Kadi is latest to join Strictly line up
item.description: The comedian and Channel 4 journalist join Angela Rippon and Layton Williams in this year's line up.

item.title: Bibby Stockholm: Barge arrivals expected in coming days - minister
item.description: The immigration minister insists the barge at Portland is safe and will not be hit by more delays.

item.title: Andy Malkinson: Living costs deduction scrapped for wrongly convicted
item.description: Andy Malkinson, who cleared his name after 17 years in jail, tells the BBC more still needs to be done.

item.title: M62: Boy, 12, killed in hit-and-run crash on motorway
item.description: The boy was struck on the eastbound carriageway of the M62 but the driver did not stop, police say.

item.title: The Crooked House: Fire rips through famed 'wonky' pub
item.description: The popular Crooked House at Himley, near Dudley, is completely destroyed by a blaze.

item.title: The remarkable recovery of Syria's earthquake baby
item.description: Six months ago today, Afraa was pulled from rubble, still attached to her umbilical cord and barely alive.

item.title: Virgin Atlantic pilots consider strike over fatigue
item.description: Members of the Balpa union have "serious concerns" over schedules put in place during Covid.

item.title: Slovenia floods 'worst-ever natural disaster'
item.description: The extreme flooding in Slovenia has caused millions of dollars worth of damage and killed at least three people.

item.title: Italian fugitive Vincenzo La Porta caught in Greece thanks to football photo
item.description: Vincenzo La Porta has been on the run for 11 years but was tracked down to Greece by police.

item.title: Typhoon Doksuri: Alarming pictures show floods in China, Philippines
item.description: The volume of rain over the past week has broken a 140-year-old record in China.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: Sweden knock USA out in penalty shootout - highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Sweden set up a quarter-final against Japan by beating defending champions USA in a dramatic penalty shootout at the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Jamie Foxx apologises and deletes Instagram post
item.description: The actor says he never intended to cause offence after his post was accused of being antisemitic.

item.title: Chatbots: Why does White House want hackers to trick AI?
item.description: Google and Meta are among big tech companies who are letting hackers try to find flaws in their chatbots.

item.title: Smuggled spider monkeys found in backpack in Texas
item.description: The US Border Patrol seized seven animals as a person was arrested in Fort Brown, Texas.

item.title: Elvis Presley's coat fetches £128k at Wiltshire auction
item.description: The custom-coat once worn by Elvis was bought by a US collector.

item.title: Kai Cenat: Police charge Twitch streamer after PS5 giveaway mayhem
item.description: Police say US influencer Kai Cenat could be charged with inciting a riot after chaos in Manhattan.

item.title: Women's World Cup: England wary of complacency in last-16 tie with Nigeria
item.description: England face Nigeria in the last 16 of the Women's World Cup with momentum on their side but must avoid complacency, says manager Sarina Wiegman.

item.title: Community Shield: Arsenal 'make statement' with victory over Manchester City
item.description: Arsenal's Community Shield win against Manchester City has lifted the "mental block" the Gunners had when facing the Premier League champions.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: Retiring Megan Rapinoe makes tearful exit as USA bow out
item.description: Retiring USA forward Megan Rapinoe exits the Women's World Cup stage in tears as the defending champions are knocked out on penalties.

item.title: Netball World Cup final highlights: Australia beat England 61-45
item.description: Watch highlights as England are beaten by Australia 45-61 in their first ever Netball World Cup final.

item.title: Netball World Cup 2023 final: What next for 'gutted but grateful' England after Australia loss?
item.description: England head coach Jess Thirlby says her side are "gutted" but "grateful" for a silver medal after their Netball World Cup final loss to Australia - but what next?

item.title: The Hundred 2023: Haris Rauf's energetic fielding and Linsey Smith's catch make plays of the day
item.description: Watch the best plays from day six of The Hundred 2023, featuring Welsh Fire's Haris Rauf, Northern Superchargers' Linsey Smith and Paige Scholfield of the Oval Invincibles.

item.title: Bryson DeChambeau hits rare 58 to win LIV Golf Greenbrier title
item.description: Bryson DeChambeau produces one of the most remarkable rounds in the history of golf on Sunday, shooting 58 to win the LIV Golf Greenbrier title.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising remains high, driven by soaring food prices.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: First time home buyers: How much can I borrow?
item.description: With rents rising, more people are crunching the numbers to see if they can afford to buy.

item.title: What is happening to house prices, and could there be a crash?
item.description: How higher interest rates are changing the UK's housing market.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: With interest rates rapidly rising, what do experts say about coping with costs?

item.title: Rent prices: How much have they gone up in your area?
item.description: Use our interactive tool to find out what the average rent is in your area.

item.title: Interest rates: How a rise affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England decided to raise interest rates again in a bid to slow price rises.

item.title: Mortgage calculator: how much will my mortgage go up?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much mortgage payments could go up for your household.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Mortgages: What happens if I am struggling to pay?
item.description: Many homeowners are worried about higher mortgage costs, but lenders must help those struggling.
